sentences.english: Binbin and Yaoyao are going to write with pens.
sentences.chinese: 彬彬和瑤瑤正準備要用蠟筆來寫。

sentences.english: He listened politely for ten minutes and then launched out.
sentences.chinese: 他彬彬有禮地聽了十分鐘，然後訓起人來了。

sentences.english: Her veneer of politeness began to crack.
sentences.chinese: 她那彬彬有禮的僞裝開始露餡兒了。
聽了這話，女推銷員彬彬有禮地報以微笑。

sentences.english: Binbin had been learning to play the violin for a year when he sat the exam.
sentences.chinese: 在彬彬參加考試之前，他已學習拉小提琴一年了。

sentences.english: He asked me politely for the book.
sentences.chinese: 他彬彬有禮地向我要那本書。

sentences.english: If I were you, I’d dress up and be well-mannered.
sentences.chinese: 如果我是你，我會穿正裝並表現得彬彬有禮。

sentences.english: The images of the ancient Confucianists were suave gentlemen with the integration of both fine in their hearts and in their appearance.
sentences.chinese: 古代儒者的形象定位是內外美統一的文質彬彬的君子。

sentences.english: Hello, my name is Binbin. What's your name?
sentences.chinese: 你好，我叫彬彬。你叫什麼名字？

sentences.english: Exercise courtesy and tact at all times.
sentences.chinese: 總是練習着彬彬有禮且老成練達。

sentences.english: Theczarina was polite but was definitely not amused.
sentences.chinese: 女沙皇彬彬有禮，但無疑並不愉快。

sentences.english: You should always keep smiling, being polite when you talk with the interviewer.
sentences.chinese: 與面試官交談時，你應彬彬有禮，始終面帶微笑。
你好，我叫彬彬。你叫什麼名字？

sentences.english: The people of this town are, for the most part, quiet and well-behaved.
sentences.chinese: 這個鎮上的人大多溫文爾雅，彬彬有禮。

sentences.english: If I were you, I'd dress up and be well-mannered.
sentences.chinese: 我是你，我會穿正裝並得彬彬有禮。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, there was a humble rabbit who had very good manners.
sentences.chinese: 從前有一隻兔子，它非常謙虛，待人處世也彬彬有禮。

definition: big pile of rocks/bighearted/open and honest
Xiaohao (c. 2200 BC), leader of the Dongyi 東夷|东夷[Dong1 yi2] or Eastern Barbarians
(Tw) (Internet slang) Greetings! (used when it's unknown what time the reader will see one's post, or just to be cute)
